summary: imagine being Tony Stark’s daughter and Lizzie’s sister and coming back to earth and finding out that Tony’s trapped in space.
title: imagine being Tony Stark’s daughter and Lizzie’s sister and coming back to earth and finding out that Tony’s trapped in space.
body:
A/N: I just hit 201 followers? SAY WHAT! It may be small but, to me, it’s really big and I wanted to say thank you! My question is when I have hit 201 followers what do you guys see next? I’m running out of ideas and I would really appreciate you to comment down below or send me in the inbox!

-

You opened your eyes and stared at the blue sky. Confusion hits you as you stood up and looked around yourself. It seemed that you were back to earth after what had happened. 

Sadness hit you like a truck as you remembered Lizzie’s sacrifice. 

-

You held Lizzie’s hand tightly and begged her not to jump the cliff to save you. ‘’Please don’t do this!’’ you begged her as your tears strimmed down. ‘’It’s the only way to be back to the earth and fight him, you know that!’’ she told you as you sobbed and looked down and then at her. ‘’What will I say to our dad?’’ 

‘‘He will know why I did it,’‘ she replied and then continued. ‘‘And Pepper too,’‘ You felt her hand is slipping because of the sweat and you tried to help her to get her up with your strength but, you couldn’t because you were weak. 

‘‘I love you and tell dad that I love him and Pepper,’‘ she told you before she went down and fell. You screamed as you watched her fall down as your magic through your veins grew stronger by the pain went in. 

As you calmed yourself down you turned back and faced him. He was looking at you with an evil smile and you were looking with him with a cold expression. ‘’You got what you wanted,’’ you replied to him and walked towards him. ( like Natasha on the GIF ) 

‘‘And now, I will destroy you after what you have done,’‘ you told him as he also started to walk towards you and prepared for the fight. ‘‘Let me watch you as you break down and kill you,’‘ he told you before as he did with his thing with the water. 

‘‘We’ll see about that,’‘ 

- 

You knew you were back at the earth. you could tell, and you wanted to see your father and Pepper so, you walked until you found the Avengers tower when you heard from the villain had talked about your father. 

- 

Natasha and Steve were in shock as they looked on the camera still when you had yelled that you were Tony Stark’s daughter. They didn’t know that he had a daughter or was even capable to take care of children. They heard footsteps as they looked at you walking in. ‘’I never knew that he had a daughter,’’ Natasha told her which made you wince a bit when she said one daughter instead of two. ‘’Two daughters actually,’’  she mumbled to herself. 

The two of them could tell that something happened but, they didn’t ask. ‘’He wanted to do that so we could be unnoticed and have a normal life,’’  she explained to them. All of them heard footsteps as it revealed Pepper walked into them with bags under her eyes. ‘’Sorry, I’m late you wanted to meet me?’’ she told them as she drifted to you. ‘’y/n,’’ she said in shock as she walked towards you and gave a tight hug before letting go. 

‘‘Tony, we, we thought -’‘ 

‘‘I know,’‘  she cut her off. 

‘‘Where’s my dad?’‘ she told her as Pepper looked back to Natasha and Steve. ‘‘You didn’t tell her?’‘ she asked them. 

‘‘We didn’t want her to know the truth,’‘ Steve explained which made you confused. What didn’t they want me to know? Pepper turned back to you. ‘‘What happened and where’s he?’‘ 

‘‘I’m sorry, Tony, he’s trapped in space,’‘

title: I Like The Bartender
body:
Summary: While Carol was in search of her identity, she runs into a witty bartender who may be of assistance on her self-discovery.

Pairing: Carol Danvers x Black Female OC [Nina]

Word Count: 1832

Inspo: Bartender by T-Pain

Warnings: fluff, Carol not having much of her Earth memory

A.N: idk about y’all, but Brie Larson is my new gf and I absolutely adored Captain Marvel, so I felt compelled to write a lil sumn sumn lol it kind of follows the movie, but not completely, so enjoy!

California’s heat was unlike anything Carol had ever experienced. Muggy with a very slight breeze. The sun blazes over the desert highway when she drove, making her wonder how anyone could ever drive here without melting. She covers her eyes as she looks upon the small building in front of her. Turning the motorcycle (that she… borrowed) off, she steps off and pushes the kickstand with her right foot. Sporting a… whatever ‘NIN’ is shirt, she walks inside Pancho’s Bar, flashbacks appear of a time where she and unknown beautiful lady spent time playing arcade games, drinking, and singing karaoke. 

The bar had an air of familiarity surrounding it. Looking around the room, Carol’s eyes zero in on the dashingly gorgeous woman behind the bar. She sports a very high afro, big golden hoops, and a Pancho’s Bar t-shirt, Carol unable to see the rest of her due to the counter top blocking her view. As she approaches the bar, something from her peripheral vision stops her in her tracks. She turns her head to the wall that’s plastered full of Air Force fighter jet pictures. As she walks closer to the wall, the picture with a winged unicorn logo on the tail of one of the jets’ tail stands out to her. She slightly touches the picture, startled when she hears a clear of a throat. She turns back to see the lady behind the bar with her arms folded, a scowl on her face.

“May I help you?” The woman asks, a slight attitude in her tone. Although her tone seemed a bit rude, Carol couldn’t help but swoon a bit over the lady’s voice; it sounded the way honey tastes: sweet and thick, her accent being unfamiliar to Carol’s ears. 

Carol looks back at the picture in front of her. “Where was this photograph taken?” 

The lady scoffs and makes her way back to the bar. Carol follows behind closely. With her arms still folded, the woman stands behind the bar, unfolds her arms and starts wiping the counter. “No clue, boo. I just work here… I wasn’t in charge of interior decorating, so I don’t know where that picture comes from, let alone where it was taken…”

Carol frowns in thought, then leans over a bit from where she stands in front of the bar top to read the woman’s name tag. Nina, it read. Nina gives Carol a puzzled look, as if she’s trying to look right through her. A gasp escapes her lips, which only leaves Carol to give the same puzzled look.

“Carol! Girl, I thought you were dead?” Nina exclaims, stopping herself from wiping the counter and instead placing her left hand on top of it, her right on her hip. 

“I’m… Vers. I’m sorry, who’s Carol?” She questions, a blank look adorns her face.

Nina looks at Carol for a split second before bursting into laughter. “Girl… Vers? Seriously? Like your last name, Danvers?”

Carol shakes her head slowly in a ‘no’ motion. Who is Carol and how does this Nina know her?

“You messing with me, right?”— when Carol shakes her head ‘no’ again, Nina’s eyes widen— “Oh snap… you really don’t know who you are anymore? Damn, that accident jacked you up!” 

Carol cracks a small smile after hearing that phrase; she may have lost her memory, but she still had a good sense of humor. Nina takes the moment to laugh too, her nose and eyes crinkling as she does so. Carol suddenly felt her stomach churn, almost giddy at hearing Nina laugh. That same air of familiarity from her arrival hits her as she looks at Nina.

**

1988. Pancho’s Bar

Maria dragged Carol to this bar for the third time this week, letting her best friend know that they both needed a break from the boys’ club known as the Air Force. Carol willingly let this happened since she knew she’d have a great time like always at the bar.

Pancho’s was always so welcoming; it didn’t matter who came in, the staff of Pancho’s had a lovely greeting for them. Tonight, was no different.

Maria and Carol walked in arm-in-arm and immediately walked to the bar. The bartender was none other than Nina herself; a beautiful, fly black woman with two small afro puffs donning her head.

“Two fuzzy navels for us, Nina!” Maria orders, gaining a nod from Nina who immediately made the drinks. 

Carol shook her head at her best friend; Maria always knew what to order to get the party started.

Nina came back with the drinks, handing each one to Carol and Maria, who tipped handsomely. Being from Louisiana, Maria downed her drink in no time, leaving Carol to drink alone. 

**

5 shots and 2 more fuzzy navels later, Maria and Carol cackle loudly at some joke made by someone sitting with them at their booth. Maria looked around the room and spotted the stage that held two microphones for karaoke. She looked back at Carol and wiggled her eyebrows. Carol rolled her eyes in return and groaned.

“Again, Maria? We just sung ‘Kiss Me Deadly’ two nights ago…”

Maria said nothing in return and dragged her best friend (like she’d been doing the entire night) up to the stage and cued the DJ to play ‘I Wanna Dance with Somebody’ by Whitney Houston. Although reluctant at first, Carol eventually got into the groove and sung her heart out along with her best friend. Carol eventually made her way behind the bar to serenade Nina and coaxed her to sing into the mic. Nina giggled and sung right along with Carol.

**

Once the bar was closing up, Maria and Carol stood in front of it, talking to a few coworkers about facing another day at the airport. Maria walked over to a telephone booth to make a call for a taxi. Carol looked between the telephone booth and the bar’s entrance, making sure Maria was safe and waiting for Nina to make her exit. Nina was in charge of closing and Carol wanted to make sure she’d make it safely to her car. When Nina exited, she locked the door behind her and smiled when she turned to see Carol waiting for her. It was a habit of Carol’s that Nina found endearing. Waving a bit, Nina walked towards Carol to thank her as always. 

In a drunken stupor, Carol softly took hold of Nina’s arm and crashed her lips into hers, moaning softly when Nina kissed back. A mix of peach schnapps and mint clashed together as the two held each other closely. Carol supposed it was liquid courage that finally had her make a move on someone she’d had her eyes on for a while. Nina was the first to break away from the kiss, leaving Carol dissatisfied. When Carol pouted, Nina giggled again and caressed Carol’s left cheeks. “You’re drunk, boo.”

Carol smiled widely and laughed a bit. “And when I’m sober, I’ll come back and do the same thing!” She hiccupped after the confession, making Nina laugh again.

She looked to where Maria stood at the telephone booth (who had been silently cheering her best friend on) and pointed to Carol. “Please make sure you two make it home safely, Maria!” 

She looked back at Carol, who had such a stupid grin on her face, Maria was bound to make fun of her for it later. Nina smiled and pinched the cheek she caressed earlier. “Goodnight, Carol.”

**

“Nina… Nina Sanders…” Carol speaks softly as she looks into Nina’s eyes. She sees those eyes getting teary and felt a shove coming from Nina.

“I thought you completely forgot!” Nina exclaims, quickly wiping a tear that fell from her eye. Carol was a dear friend to Nina, so when she heard the news of Carol’s ‘death’, it took a toll on her, too. When Carol walked into Pancho’s and didn’t seem to recognize the place, let alone her and their moment back in ’88, Nina began to lose hope. But leave it to Carol to defy the odds.

“We sung to Whitney Houston the night we kissed… I think your laugh… triggered that memory for me.” Carol admits, subconsciously touching her lips.

Nina wears a smugly grin, similar to that of Carol’s that night after their kiss. Carol’s smile quickly fades into a frown, pondering of the whereabouts of Maria.

“Where’s—”

“Maria? Well, after your accident, she moved back to Louisiana…” Nina speaks somberly, saddened that her two favorite customers (and close friends) became separated by such a tragic thing.

Carol looks back to the picture on the wall, closing in on the details. A logo of a winged unicorn is displayed on the tail of the airplane. She points back to it again. “Where’s Pegasus?”

Before Nina could open her mouth, Director Nick Fury coolly strolled into the place to interrupt. “That’s classified. Not unlike the file I started on you.”
Carol looks to Nina apologetically before eyeing Fury and slowly walking over to the table near him. “But I see you changed it up a bit since then. Grunge is a good look for you.” Fury comments jokingly.

Nina took this as a cue to actually prep for the bar’s opening in a few hours. Carol took the opportunity to test Fury to see if it was actually him or a Skrull. Once he seemingly passed, Fury questions Carol on whether she’s a Skrull or not. She calmly blasts energy out her fists towards the jukebox on the opposite side of the room. She cheekily rests her head back on her fist. Fury turns around to check out the jukebox, he looks back to her confused and concerned. In the background, they hear Nina yell ‘what the fuck, Carol!?’ as she hurriedly ran over to check the damage.

**

Once Carol and Fury decide to head out in search for Pegasus, Carol tells Fury to wait by the door. He listens, waiting at the door since he sensed he’d interrupted earlier. Carol half jogs to the bar counter again, Nina looking up at her in feigned anger. “I’m sorry about the jukebox, Nina.” 

Nina rolls her eyes and laughs a bit. “Don’t even trip, C-baby!” 

Carol looks confused by the phrase (and the nickname) until Nina clarifies that the jukebox incident is fine. They share a laugh between each other before silently grinning at one another. Carol turns to walk away, but suddenly turns back around. She approaches the counter closer than earlier, leaning ever so slightly in Nina’s personal space. “By the way, I’m sober now.”

Nina beams at her and the two share a brief, but slightly steamy kiss. Carol’s the first to break away, booping Nina’s nose with her finger before walking away backwards.

“Tell Maria and Monica I said ‘hey’, alright?”

Carol salutes her then turns around to face Fury and they exit the building in search for Dr. Lawson and Pegasus.

**

She slightly touches the picture, startled when she hears a clear of a throat. She turns back to see the lady behind the bar with her arms folded, a scowl on her face.

“May I help you?” The woman asks, a slight attitude in her tone. Although her tone seemed a bit rude, Carol couldn’t help but swoon a bit over the lady’s voice; it sounded the way honey tastes: sweet and thick, her accent being unfamiliar to Carol’s ears. 

[[MORE]]

Carol looks back at the picture in front of her. “Where was this photograph taken?” 

The lady scoffs and makes her way back to the bar. Carol follows behind closely. With her arms still folded, the woman stands behind the bar, unfolds her arms and starts wiping the counter. “No clue, boo. I just work here… I wasn’t in charge of interior decorating, so I don’t know where that picture comes from, let alone where it was taken…”

Carol frowns in thought, then leans over a bit from where she stands in front of the bar top to read the woman’s name tag. Nina, it read. Nina gives Carol a puzzled look, as if she’s trying to look right through her. A gasp escapes her lips, which only leaves Carol to give the same puzzled look.

“Carol! Girl, I thought you were dead?” Nina exclaims, stopping herself from wiping the counter and instead placing her left hand on top of it, her right on her hip. 

“I’m… Vers. I’m sorry, who’s Carol?” She questions, a blank look adorns her face.

Nina looks at Carol for a split second before bursting into laughter. “Girl… Vers? Seriously? Like your last name, Danvers?”

Carol shakes her head slowly in a ‘no’ motion. Who is Carol and how does this Nina know her?

“You messing with me, right?”— when Carol shakes her head ‘no’ again, Nina’s eyes widen— “Oh snap… you really don’t know who you are anymore? Damn, that accident jacked you up!” 

Carol cracks a small smile after hearing that phrase; she may have lost her memory, but she still had a good sense of humor. Nina takes the moment to laugh too, her nose and eyes crinkling as she does so. Carol suddenly felt her stomach churn, almost giddy at hearing Nina laugh. That same air of familiarity from her arrival hits her as she looks at Nina.

**

1988. Pancho’s Bar

Maria dragged Carol to this bar for the third time this week, letting her best friend know that they both needed a break from the boys’ club known as the Air Force. Carol willingly let this happened since she knew she’d have a great time like always at the bar.

Pancho’s was always so welcoming; it didn’t matter who came in, the staff of Pancho’s had a lovely greeting for them. Tonight, was no different.

Maria and Carol walked in arm-in-arm and immediately walked to the bar. The bartender was none other than Nina herself; a beautiful, fly black woman with two small afro puffs donning her head.

“Two fuzzy navels for us, Nina!” Maria orders, gaining a nod from Nina who immediately made the drinks. 

Carol shook her head at her best friend; Maria always knew what to order to get the party started.

Nina came back with the drinks, handing each one to Carol and Maria, who tipped handsomely. Being from Louisiana, Maria downed her drink in no time, leaving Carol to drink alone. 

**

5 shots and 2 more fuzzy navels later, Maria and Carol cackle loudly at some joke made by someone sitting with them at their booth. Maria looked around the room and spotted the stage that held two microphones for karaoke. She looked back at Carol and wiggled her eyebrows. Carol rolled her eyes in return and groaned.

“Again, Maria? We just sung ‘Kiss Me Deadly’ two nights ago…”

Maria said nothing in return and dragged her best friend (like she’d been doing the entire night) up to the stage and cued the DJ to play ‘I Wanna Dance with Somebody’ by Whitney Houston. Although reluctant at first, Carol eventually got into the groove and sung her heart out along with her best friend. Carol eventually made her way behind the bar to serenade Nina and coaxed her to sing into the mic. Nina giggled and sung right along with Carol.

**

Once the bar was closing up, Maria and Carol stood in front of it, talking to a few coworkers about facing another day at the airport. Maria walked over to a telephone booth to make a call for a taxi. Carol looked between the telephone booth and the bar’s entrance, making sure Maria was safe and waiting for Nina to make her exit. Nina was in charge of closing and Carol wanted to make sure she’d make it safely to her car. When Nina exited, she locked the door behind her and smiled when she turned to see Carol waiting for her. It was a habit of Carol’s that Nina found endearing. Waving a bit, Nina walked towards Carol to thank her as always. 

In a drunken stupor, Carol softly took hold of Nina’s arm and crashed her lips into hers, moaning softly when Nina kissed back. A mix of peach schnapps and mint clashed together as the two held each other closely. Carol supposed it was liquid courage that finally had her make a move on someone she’d had her eyes on for a while. Nina was the first to break away from the kiss, leaving Carol dissatisfied. When Carol pouted, Nina giggled again and caressed Carol’s left cheeks. “You’re drunk, boo.”

Carol smiled widely and laughed a bit. “And when I’m sober, I’ll come back and do the same thing!” She hiccupped after the confession, making Nina laugh again.

She looked to where Maria stood at the telephone booth (who had been silently cheering her best friend on) and pointed to Carol. “Please make sure you two make it home safely, Maria!” 

She looked back at Carol, who had such a stupid grin on her face, Maria was bound to make fun of her for it later. Nina smiled and pinched the cheek she caressed earlier. “Goodnight, Carol.”

**

“Nina… Nina Sanders…” Carol speaks softly as she looks into Nina’s eyes. She sees those eyes getting teary and felt a shove coming from Nina.

“I thought you completely forgot!” Nina exclaims, quickly wiping a tear that fell from her eye. Carol was a dear friend to Nina, so when she heard the news of Carol’s ‘death’, it took a toll on her, too. When Carol walked into Pancho’s and didn’t seem to recognize the place, let alone her and their moment back in ’88, Nina began to lose hope. But leave it to Carol to defy the odds.

“We sung to Whitney Houston the night we kissed… I think your laugh… triggered that memory for me.” Carol admits, subconsciously touching her lips.

Nina wears a smugly grin, similar to that of Carol’s that night after their kiss. Carol’s smile quickly fades into a frown, pondering of the whereabouts of Maria.

“Where’s—”

“Maria? Well, after your accident, she moved back to Louisiana…” Nina speaks somberly, saddened that her two favorite customers (and close friends) became separated by such a tragic thing.

Carol looks back to the picture on the wall, closing in on the details. A logo of a winged unicorn is displayed on the tail of the airplane. She points back to it again. “Where’s Pegasus?”

Before Nina could open her mouth, Director Nick Fury coolly strolled into the place to interrupt. “That’s classified. Not unlike the file I started on you.”
Carol looks to Nina apologetically before eyeing Fury and slowly walking over to the table near him. “But I see you changed it up a bit since then. Grunge is a good look for you.” Fury comments jokingly.

Nina took this as a cue to actually prep for the bar’s opening in a few hours. Carol took the opportunity to test Fury to see if it was actually him or a Skrull. Once he seemingly passed, Fury questions Carol on whether she’s a Skrull or not. She calmly blasts energy out her fists towards the jukebox on the opposite side of the room. She cheekily rests her head back on her fist. Fury turns around to check out the jukebox, he looks back to her confused and concerned. In the background, they hear Nina yell ‘what the fuck, Carol!?’ as she hurriedly ran over to check the damage.

**

Once Carol and Fury decide to head out in search for Pegasus, Carol tells Fury to wait by the door. He listens, waiting at the door since he sensed he’d interrupted earlier. Carol half jogs to the bar counter again, Nina looking up at her in feigned anger. “I’m sorry about the jukebox, Nina.” 

Nina rolls her eyes and laughs a bit. “Don’t even trip, C-baby!” 

Carol looks confused by the phrase (and the nickname) until Nina clarifies that the jukebox incident is fine. They share a laugh between each other before silently grinning at one another. Carol turns to walk away, but suddenly turns back around. She approaches the counter closer than earlier, leaning ever so slightly in Nina’s personal space. “By the way, I’m sober now.”

Nina beams at her and the two share a brief, but slightly steamy kiss. Carol’s the first to break away, booping Nina’s nose with her finger before walking away backwards.

“Tell Maria and Monica I said ‘hey’, alright?”

Carol salutes her then turns around to face Fury and they exit the building in search for Dr. Lawson and Pegasus.

**

Maria walked over to a telephone booth to make a call for a taxi. Carol looked between the telephone booth and the bar’s entrance, making sure Maria was safe and waiting for Nina to make her exit. Nina was in charge of closing and Carol wanted to make sure she’d make it safely to her car. When Nina exited, she locked the door behind her and smiled when she turned to see Carol waiting for her. It was a habit of Carol’s that Nina found endearing. Waving a bit, Nina walked towards Carol to thank her as always. 

In a drunken stupor, Carol softly took hold of Nina’s arm and crashed her lips into hers, moaning softly when Nina kissed back. A mix of peach schnapps and mint clashed together as the two held each other closely. Carol supposed it was liquid courage that finally had her make a move on someone she’d had her eyes on for a while. Nina was the first to break away from the kiss, leaving Carol dissatisfied. When Carol pouted, Nina giggled again and caressed Carol’s left cheeks. “You’re drunk, boo.”

Carol smiled widely and laughed a bit. “And when I’m sober, I’ll come back and do the same thing!” She hiccupped after the confession, making Nina laugh again.

She looked to where Maria stood at the telephone booth (who had been silently cheering her best friend on) and pointed to Carol. “Please make sure you two make it home safely, Maria!” 

She looked back at Carol, who had such a stupid grin on her face, Maria was bound to make fun of her for it later. Nina smiled and pinched the cheek she caressed earlier. “Goodnight, Carol.”

**

“Nina… Nina Sanders…” Carol speaks softly as she looks into Nina’s eyes. She sees those eyes getting teary and felt a shove coming from Nina.

“I thought you completely forgot!” Nina exclaims, quickly wiping a tear that fell from her eye. Carol was a dear friend to Nina, so when she heard the news of Carol’s ‘death’, it took a toll on her, too. When Carol walked into Pancho’s and didn’t seem to recognize the place, let alone her and their moment back in ’88, Nina began to lose hope. But leave it to Carol to defy the odds.

“We sung to Whitney Houston the night we kissed… I think your laugh… triggered that memory for me.” Carol admits, subconsciously touching her lips.

Nina wears a smugly grin, similar to that of Carol’s that night after their kiss. Carol’s smile quickly fades into a frown, pondering of the whereabouts of Maria.

“Where’s—”

“Maria? Well, after your accident, she moved back to Louisiana…” Nina speaks somberly, saddened that her two favorite customers (and close friends) became separated by such a tragic thing.

Carol looks back to the picture on the wall, closing in on the details. A logo of a winged unicorn is displayed on the tail of the airplane. She points back to it again. “Where’s Pegasus?”

Before Nina could open her mouth, Director Nick Fury coolly strolled into the place to interrupt. “That’s classified. Not unlike the file I started on you.”
Carol looks to Nina apologetically before eyeing Fury and slowly walking over to the table near him. “But I see you changed it up a bit since then. Grunge is a good look for you.” Fury comments jokingly.

Nina took this as a cue to actually prep for the bar’s opening in a few hours. Carol took the opportunity to test Fury to see if it was actually him or a Skrull. Once he seemingly passed, Fury questions Carol on whether she’s a Skrull or not. She calmly blasts energy out her fists towards the jukebox on the opposite side of the room. She cheekily rests her head back on her fist. Fury turns around to check out the jukebox, he looks back to her confused and concerned. In the background, they hear Nina yell ‘what the fuck, Carol!?’ as she hurriedly ran over to check the damage.

**

Once Carol and Fury decide to head out in search for Pegasus, Carol tells Fury to wait by the door. He listens, waiting at the door since he sensed he’d interrupted earlier. Carol half jogs to the bar counter again, Nina looking up at her in feigned anger. “I’m sorry about the jukebox, Nina.” 

Nina rolls her eyes and laughs a bit. “Don’t even trip, C-baby!” 

Carol looks confused by the phrase (and the nickname) until Nina clarifies that the jukebox incident is fine. They share a laugh between each other before silently grinning at one another. Carol turns to walk away, but suddenly turns back around. She approaches the counter closer than earlier, leaning ever so slightly in Nina’s personal space. “By the way, I’m sober now.”

Nina beams at her and the two share a brief, but slightly steamy kiss. Carol’s the first to break away, booping Nina’s nose with her finger before walking away backwards.

“Tell Maria and Monica I said ‘hey’, alright?”

Carol salutes her then turns around to face Fury and they exit the building in search for Dr. Lawson and Pegasus.

**

A.N: I’ll probably do this more often now, but please don’t hesitate to leave feedback! Whether it’s directly on the post or in the tags, it’s greatly appreciated! It definitely helps me write more lol
trail.content_abstract:
Summary: While Carol was in search of her identity, she runs into a witty bartender who may be of assistance on her self-discovery.

Pairing: Carol Danvers x Black Female OC [Nina]

Word Count: 1832

Inspo: Bartender by T-Pain

Warnings: fluff, Carol not having much of her Earth memory

A.N: idk about y’all, but Brie Larson is my new gf and I absolutely adored Captain Marvel, so I felt compelled to write a lil sumn sumn lol it kind of follows the movie, but not completely, so enjoy!

California’s heat was unlike anything Carol had ever experienced. Muggy with a very slight breeze. The sun blazes over the desert highway when she drove, making her wonder how anyone could ever drive here without melting. She covers her eyes as she looks upon the small building in front of her. Turning the motorcycle (that she… borrowed) off, she steps off and pushes the kickstand with her right foot. Sporting a… whatever ‘NIN’ is shirt, she walks inside Pancho’s Bar, flashbacks appear of a time where she and unknown beautiful lady spent time playing arcade games, drinking, and singing karaoke. 

The bar had an air of familiarity surrounding it. Looking around the room, Carol’s eyes zero in on the dashingly gorgeous woman behind the bar. She sports a very high afro, big golden hoops, and a Pancho’s Bar t-shirt, Carol unable to see the rest of her due to the counter top blocking her view. As she approaches the bar, something from her peripheral vision stops her in her tracks. She turns her head to the wall that’s plastered full of Air Force fighter jet pictures. As she walks closer to the wall, the picture with a winged unicorn logo on the tail of one of the jets’ tail stands out to her. She slightly touches the picture, startled when she hears a clear of a throat. She turns back to see the lady behind the bar with her arms folded, a scowl on her face.

“May I help you?” The woman asks, a slight attitude in her tone. Although her tone seemed a bit rude, Carol couldn’t help but swoon a bit over the lady’s voice; it sounded the way honey tastes: sweet and thick, her accent being unfamiliar to Carol’s ears.

body:
Sorcerers supporting Sorcerers

I read “Reborn” by @i-write-and-stuff (check it out, I liked it a lot) and noticed how Stephen and Wanda worked together. I don’t know why but I got weirdly emotional by thinking about how almost everyone else is wary about the protagonist but the magic kids aren’t. They accept her, somehow.

Guys, all I’m saying is… Sorcerers supporting Sorcerers. It’s my jam.

Outcasts sticking together. Forgetting their differences for a second and finding comfort in being weird together. I don’t know. Maybe I’ll turn this into a longer fanfiction one day, I’m not sure yet.

So I don’t really know what this piece here is, but there you go. Feedback is very appreciated:) Enjoy!

**********************************************

Sorcerers supporting Sorcerers

Mantis doesn’t ask how someone is feeling. She stands there, a hand on their shoulder, their arm or their cheek. They look into her black eyes and turn away, leaving as fast as possible. She knows and stays by herself until the next person crosses her way.

Everyone looks scared when Wanda is close to them. The thought of her being able to see their biggest fears makes them uneasy, careful and wary around her. She does everything to not appear dangerous.

Stephen’s stern look earns nothing but pity once they see his shaking hands. Adapting to be seen differently was hard, but he mastered it. Sometimes he thinks about going back in time. Back to when he was a well respected doctor. He never does it.

Loki creates illusions when he feels lonely. Of Frigga mostly, sometimes Thor, never Odin. Nowadays he finds comfort and calmness in his own seidr. It’s a part of him, and he grew to accept it. ‘Witch’ is no insult anymore.

Carol wakes up in the middle of the night, her fingers tingling with electricity. Anger and bad conscience run through her veins. She flies mile after mile trying to escape before she embraces these feelings. She is in control now.

It’s coincidence that they meet.

Loki sees Carol and feels a rush of homesickness burning through his bones. They grin at each other. The tickling electricity around her calms down when Loki’s calming coldness surrounds her.

Mantis touches Wanda’s hand and feels nothing, they stare at each other in horror for a second. Wanda can not read an empty mind, Mantis does not fear a thing. She never feels. Their hands stay entwined, and they don’t need words to know what they feel is called belonging.

Stephen feels it too. Around him there is magic, seidr, sheer power. For the first time since long he doesn’t feel the need to hide his hands behind his back. Time moves faster when he is surrounded by people like Wanda, Mantis, Loki or Carol. And for once that has nothing to do with his powers.
